column2: Tristan Wirfs Returns To Training, Rehab On Monday
column3: Most offensive lineman take a beating through a season. That includes Bucs All-Pro left tackle Tristan Wirfs, who sprained his knee early in November against the 49ers and also dealt with an ankle issue. So Wirfs has been enjoying rest and relaxation since the Bucs’ season ended but that extended chill ends next week. “I’ll start training on Monday, slowly get back into it, moving around,” Wirfs told WDAE. “Getting back in the rehab and everything. Feeling good. It’s nice to take a little time off.” Joe’s glad it sounds like Wirfs doesn’t have any lingering issues. And Wirfs will have his training buddy waiting for him, Bucs right tackle Luke Goedeke. Per Wirfs, Goedeke already has resumed mauling in the gym. Joe can only imagine how jacked up Goedeke will be entering the final year of his rookie contract.
column9: Wirfs returns to training after injury for upcoming football season.
column11: Mix of cautious optimism and slight concerns about player health and draft strategy.

column2: Barkley’s Remorse: The Final Chapter (And A Super Bowl Betting Preview)
column3: Todd previews SB LIX from a betting perspective and discusses how his 9-3 run against the spread in these playoffs give him some house money to use the odds of a big Philadelphia win to his advantage. The Todd Wright Survivor Football Podcast is presented by Brandon Legal Group. The Todd Wright Survivor Football Podcast is also found on iHeart Radio. Click above to listen or download.
column9: Super Bowl betting preview with impressive playoff record.

column2: “We Know What We Need To Fix”
column3: So many NFL players descend upon the Super Bowl site every year, this time New Orleans, and wander through the media center where one can find radio row. Bucs running back Rachaad White stopped in to chat with Baker Machado of Front Office Sports. There, White talked about the season that was and his look at the Bucs for 2025. “Our expectations are high,” White said. “They were high this year. “We let a couple of close games slip. We felt like we should have won. It came down to the wire. “And then, obviously, we let the last game of the season slip. It came down to the wire. But you have to give credit where it is do.” How much different would the season had been if the Bucs were able to take care of business in Atlanta and Kansas City, and even at home against San Francisco? Joe still cannot blame players for the Kansas City loss in overtime. The Bucs were down Mike Evans and Chris Godwin and still had a chance for a game-winning score in their last possession of regulation. “We know what we need to fix,” White said. “We need to build on [last season]. “We got new changes once again in our building. This is my fourth year with a new OC. But I’m pretty sure you can lean on Baker because of what he has been through.” It stinks for White that Liam Coen left. White easily had his best season running the ball. Can White build on that? Will new offensive coordinator Josh Grizzard be able to reignite White’s strong skills in the pass game? Time will only tell. Ira Kaufman Talks Josh Grizzard Introduction, Myles Garrett Trade Likelihood & Cost, And Much More
column9: Bucs reflecting on past season and optimistic for future.
column11: Comments are mixed with concerns about player usage, defense, and coaching decisions.

column3: Lots of nuggets come from Media Row at the Super Bowl. Joe’s got a bunch to share over the next few weeks.  It’s a place where the entertainment world and the NFL cross paths a bit and Joe got this one from the Dumb Zone podcast. So actor/comedian Jeremy Piven, the Entourage star, is a big football fan and explained on this show that he loves Baker Mayfield and called him “one of the real ones.” Naturally, Piven was then asked how Mayfield got on his radar. “You know, doing Entourage, and [Mark] Wahlberg is infatuated with him. I don’t know how I got on his radar; I was somehow in Cleveland doing [standup] shows. … And I was in Cleveland and just connected with Baker when he was playing with them. And he’s one of these guys who like came out to the show. He shows up. He’s not one of these guys who says, ‘I’ll be there,’ and doesn’t show up.” Piven went on to ramble about Mayfield’s drive and football IQ. The tide certainly is turning for Mayfield when it comes to national perception. No, not because some Hollywood dudes have a man crush. Mayfield has gone from castoff joke in the minds of national NFL pundits to a quarterback worthy of a degree of respect. A strong 2025 season from Mayfield should remove the unwarranted lingering stink and doubt from the all national conversations about him. At that point, the Bucs might have a beloved and bonafide celebrity as their franchise QB. Ira Kaufman Talks Josh Grizzard Introduction, Myles Garrett Trade Likelihood & Cost, And Much More
column9: Baker Mayfield admiration gaining positive attention.
column11: Fans overwhelmingly support Baker Mayfield, criticize media, Browns, and praise his potential and resilience.

column2: Todd Bowles Doesn’t Care What Outsiders Think
column3: The Kirk Cousins drumbeat began about 11 months ago after the first wave of free agency. The Dixie Chicks signed Cousins. The Bucs, who some thought would win just two games (!) the prior, were toast. They’re run is over. Perhaps the most underachieving Pro Bowl quarterback in the NFL, Cousins was supposed to lead the Dixie Chicks to the Super Bowl. Good times in Atlanta. This was barked over and over and over and over again through October. Something funny happened along the way. The Dixie Chicks stunk. Cousins was beaten up and eventually benched. In a playoff run! Who benches the next Hall of Fame quarterback in a playoff run? (Please note Joe’s sarcasm.) The Bucs won 10 games and another division title. So they exceeded expectations, right? Bowles scoffed at this last month and bluntly said what someone in Los Angeles or Cincinnati or New England — who has never been to a Bucs training camp practice or ever sat inside One Buc Palace — has to say about his team means nothing to him. “We underachieved as far as ourselves are concerned,” Bowles said. “We don’t worry about external expectations. Our internal expectations were for us to go to the Super Bowl. “Injury or regardless, our internal expectations are to go to the Super Bowl. We did not get that accomplished. “We did some good things throughout the year, yes. We had guys injured, yes. We got to the playoffs, yes but our expectations are to win the Super Bowl.” Tomorrow is the Super Bowl but the Bucs were bounced at home in the wild card round. Bowles has said this offseason is time for reflection. How can he be a better coach? How can the Bucs be a better team. Well, a starting point is very simple to Joe: Go get a friggin’ edge rusher. Ira Kaufman Talks Josh Grizzard Introduction, Myles Garrett Trade Likelihood & Cost, And Much More
column11: Mixed sentiments about Todd Bowles' coaching decisions, defense, and expectations for the team's success.

column2: Josh Grizzard Receives Tristan Wirfs’ Stamp Of Approval
column3: OK, so Joe is going to do some dot-connecting here. Joe might be off, but perhaps not. If Baker Mayfield had an issue with new Bucs offensive coordinator Josh Grizzard or didn’t like him or didn’t think Grizzard could get the job done running the Bucs offense, Grizzard might still be a “passing game coordinator.” Or he might just be in Jacksonville. Bucs All-Pro tackle Tristan Wirfs and Mayfield are very tight. The two are great friends and if they’re not at home, they’re either at One Buc Palace or they are hanging out somewhere or fishing. So Joe doesn’t believe Wirfs would rave about Grizzard being his new coordinator if Mayfield told him Grizzard was a mistake of a hire. Speaking with Ari Meirov of The33rdTeam, Wirfs seemed genuinely pumped to have Grizzard taking over for the departed Liam Coen. “We’re excited bout ‘Griz,’ too,” Wirfs said. “He was here this year. Knows the system like the back of his hand. “He’s a wizard. It’s going to be fun.” That’s comforting. Joe doesn’t know he excited to be about Grizzard because he has very big shoes to fill. And Joe is suspicious a first-time play-caller can actually make an offense more explosive than the third-best offense in the game. Joe is keen on seeing what sort of wrinkles Grizzard can work into the offense he inherited.
column9: Tristan Wirfs praises Grizzard as new offensive coordinator.
column11: Overall, the sentiment is cautiously optimistic with some concerns about high expectations for the new OC.
column12: {"commenter0": {"username": "ReeeBarrr", "post": "Psyched to see it play out!", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "12:10", "am"]}, "commenter1": {"username": "White Tiger", "post": "I keep hearing folks focus on Grizzard comments about making this offense more explosive than last season. I watched the presser \u2013 I took it to mean more explosive plays. I don\u2019t think he was making a comment to one-up Coen\u2019s offense \u2013 I think it was a hint that the deep ball may be back on the menu.", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "2:24", "am"]}, "commenter2": {"username": "MadMax", "post": "Griz will be fine\u2026.hes a D reader just like Baker", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "2:45", "am"]}, "commenter3": {"username": "Aqualung", "post": "Baker, with line of scrimmage autonomy, gets the job well and gets it done.  ", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "2:59", "am"]}, "commenter4": {"username": "Kenton Smith", "post": "Just finished listening to, me and the old hound, my favorite podcast. Ira and the Joes thinking Mayfield had a lot of influence on our OC hiring. I\u2019m sure if Mayfield thought Tristan or Mike or any of our players weren\u2019t of the same mind then Griz would not be our OC. Looks like the whole organization is on board. Baker is finally getting some luck that hard work and perseverance always pays. He was lucky with Canales for a year and Coen for a year. And No More! Now we\u2019ve got the right guy who is just an extension of the team, it\u2019s the players who are going to get this team over the hump. Baker and Tristan and Mike and TB and JL are the leaders of this team. TB and JL and Griz are going to let them play some football and they are going to win alot of games the next 5 year\u2019s. Character matters and this team has it in spades. GM and coach have alot to do with that. Speaking of which, Jason Licht it is commendable the type of organizational character we appear to have here. But in my mind if you don\u2019t extend Todd Bowles contract and give him a healthy raise before anything else you do this offseason then you have fallen short of my expectations.", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "4:33", "am"]}, "commenter5": {"username": "stpetebucsfan", "post": "Hope and optimism are good things!!!  There is every reason to be optimistic about the Buc\u2019s offense!!!", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "4:51", "am"]}, "commenter6": {"username": "heyjude", "post": "\u201cGrizzard is a Wizard.\u201d Love it!", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "4:56", "am"]}, "commenter7": {"username": "stpetebucsfan", "post": "Agree Jude.  \u201cGrizzard the Wizard\u201d.  If he succeeds he has a ready made nickname.", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "5:08", "am"]}, "commenter8": {"username": "heyjude", "post": "stpetebucsfan \u2013 You said it right, \u201cHope and Optimism.\u201d When playing Bucky, Baker, Mike, Godwin, and others really did make Coen and Canales look good. Thinking though, Grizz has been the key guy behind the curtain. Looking forward to this next season.", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "5:38", "am"]}, "commenter9": {"username": "Defense Rules", "post": "Agree with St Pete\u2019s analysis that Griz has been given quite an offense to work with.  Oline significantly improved with the addition of Barton & Bredeson 9who we need to re-sign).  Our RB stable obviously improved with the addition of Bucky.  Our WR stable improved with the addition of McMillan.  Our TE stable improved because Durham got a lot more work (430 snaps in 2024 vs only 138 in 2023).  Most importantly IMO, Baker Mayfield stayed healthy all year and improved A BUNCH in how he runs this offense.  Griz will be fine as our new OC.", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "5:53", "am"]}, "commenter10": {"username": "Pahpahmike", "post": "I admit that when Coen said he was staying and then he was gone was a dull moment however, when information started to surface that Grizzard and the other assistant was over half of Coen\u2019s success, I started to think  1st, the Bucs offense was at least in the middle of the top offenses in the NFL last season with a first time play caller and Bowles, dislike him or not and Licht have put together a heck of a roaster and coaching staff so why not be optimistic. Then when word came that Grizzard would be the OC one of the main guys who helped construct that top 10 offense from last year, that was more reason to be optimistic", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "5:58", "am"]}, "commenter11": {"username": "JustOneGame", "post": "Unfortunately for Griz, if his players fail to execute a handoff, drop a pass, fumble the ball, throw a pick or miss a block it will be his fault. By some people\u2019s standards he\u2019s already doomed and will never be accredited even if the offense is top 5 in the league. ", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "7:55", "am"]}, "commenter12": {"username": "Kenton Smith", "post": "JustOneGame spews crap like this Joe and I get edited for what Joe? Suggesting that our head coach needs an extension and a raise?  Good call Joe. Good call.", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "8:28", "am"]}, "commenter13": {"username": "Hodad", "post": "Hopefully he\u2019s good enough to where we lose him like Coen, and Canales.", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "8:37", "am"]}, "commenter14": {"username": "Fan of the South", "post": "So the Bucs now have a 3rd Crew Chief in the 3 seasons. His job is to get the Car (the offense) which is one of the fastest running at it best. Mayfield is the driver and will occasionally sit in the first row , usually finish just off the lead lap, and never take the checkered flag. ", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "8:49", "am"]}, "commenter15": {"username": "Beeej", "post": "I was kind of nonplussed about the guy at FIRST, then I read her was the 3rd down wizard. WELL! LFG!", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "8:50", "am"]}, "commenter16": {"username": "JimBobBuc", "post": "No surprise when players endorse Griz, that\u2019s to be expected.  ", "post_time": ["February", "8th,", "2025", "at", "8:52", "am"]}}
